metadata.name: Requirements Validation & Verification Checklist
metadata.description: Comprehensive checklist for validating and verifying requirements completeness, consistency, feasibility, and testability using industry best practices

content:
# Requirements Validation & Verification Checklist

## Document Information

**Project:** {{PROJECT_NAME}}  
**Requirements Document:** {{DOCUMENT_NAME}}  
**Version:** {{VERSION}}  
**Review Date:** {{REVIEW_DATE}}  
**Reviewer:** {{REVIEWER_NAME}}  
**Review Type:** {{REVIEW_TYPE}}  

---

## 1. Completeness Criteria

### 1.1 Requirement Coverage
- [ ] All functional requirements documented
- [ ] All non-functional requirements documented
- [ ] All system interfaces identified
- [ ] All external dependencies listed
- [ ] All constraints documented
- [ ] All assumptions stated explicitly
- [ ] Data requirements specified
- [ ] Security requirements defined
- [ ] Performance requirements quantified

**Notes:** {{COMPLETENESS_NOTES}}

### 1.2 Requirement Attributes
Each requirement has:
- [ ] Unique identifier (REQ-XXX)
- [ ] Clear description
- [ ] Priority level (High/Medium/Low)
- [ ] Source/originator
- [ ] Rationale/justification
- [ ] Acceptance criteria
- [ ] Dependencies identified
- [ ] Status indicator

**Missing Attributes:** {{MISSING_ATTRIBUTES}}

---

## 2. Consistency Criteria

### 2.1 Internal Consistency
- [ ] No conflicting requirements
- [ ] Terminology used consistently
- [ ] Requirements don't contradict each other
- [ ] Same requirement not stated differently in multiple places
- [ ] Dependencies are bidirectional and consistent
- [ ] Priorities are logically consistent

**Inconsistencies Found:** {{INCONSISTENCIES}}

### 2.2 External Consistency
- [ ] Aligns with business objectives
- [ ] Consistent with existing systems
- [ ] Complies with regulations and standards
- [ ] Matches stakeholder expectations
- [ ] Compatible with technology constraints
- [ ] Aligns with architectural decisions

**External Conflicts:** {{EXTERNAL_CONFLICTS}}

---

## 3. Clarity & Unambiguity

### 3.1 Language Quality
- [ ] Requirements written in clear, simple language
- [ ] No vague terms ("user-friendly", "fast", "easy")
- [ ] Quantifiable metrics provided where applicable
- [ ] Technical jargon defined in glossary
- [ ] Each requirement has single interpretation
- [ ] Active voice used (not passive)
- [ ] No compound requirements (one req per statement)

**Ambiguous Requirements:** {{AMBIGUOUS_REQS}}

### 3.2 Measurability
- [ ] Performance metrics quantified (e.g., "< 200ms")
- [ ] Capacity requirements specified with numbers
- [ ] Availability targets defined (e.g., "99.9% uptime")
- [ ] User load specified (e.g., "10,000 concurrent users")
- [ ] Response times quantified
- [ ] Error rates specified

**Non-Measurable Requirements:** {{NON_MEASURABLE}}

---

## 4. Feasibility & Realism

### 4.1 Technical Feasibility
- [ ] Requirements achievable with current technology
- [ ] No physics/mathematical impossibilities
- [ ] Team has necessary technical skills
- [ ] Required tools and platforms available
- [ ] Integration with existing systems feasible
- [ ] Performance targets realistic

**Feasibility Concerns:** {{FEASIBILITY_CONCERNS}}

### 4.2 Resource Feasibility
- [ ] Achievable within budget constraints
- [ ] Sufficient development time allocated
- [ ] Required infrastructure available or acquirable
- [ ] Third-party services accessible
- [ ] Team capacity sufficient

**Resource Constraints:** {{RESOURCE_CONSTRAINTS}}

---

## 5. Testability & Verifiability

### 5.1 Test Criteria
- [ ] Each requirement has acceptance criteria
- [ ] Acceptance criteria are measurable
- [ ] Test scenarios can be derived
- [ ] Success/failure criteria are clear
- [ ] Test data requirements identified
- [ ] Test environment needs specified

**Non-Testable Requirements:** {{NON_TESTABLE}}

### 5.2 Verification Methods
For each requirement, verification method defined:
- [ ] Testing/demonstration
- [ ] Inspection/review
- [ ] Analysis/simulation
- [ ] Certification/compliance check

**Missing Verification Methods:** {{MISSING_VERIFICATION}}

---

## 6. Necessity & Value

### 6.1 Business Value
- [ ] Each requirement traceable to business objective
- [ ] Value proposition clearly stated
- [ ] Cost-benefit justified
- [ ] Aligns with product vision
- [ ] Stakeholder approval obtained
- [ ] No "nice-to-have" requirements in "must-have" category

**Questionable Requirements:** {{QUESTIONABLE_REQS}}

### 6.2 User Needs
- [ ] Requirements address actual user needs
- [ ] User personas identified
- [ ] User workflows considered
- [ ] User feedback incorporated
- [ ] Accessibility requirements included

**User Need Gaps:** {{USER_GAPS}}

---

## 7. Maintainability

### 7.1 Documentation Quality
- [ ] Well-organized structure
- [ ] Table of contents present
- [ ] Searchable format (digital)
- [ ] Version control in place
- [ ] Change history tracked
- [ ] Cross-references working
- [ ] Diagrams/visuals included where helpful

**Documentation Issues:** {{DOC_ISSUES}}

### 7.2 Traceability
- [ ] Requirements traceable to source (stakeholder/regulation)
- [ ] Forward traceability to design/code/tests established
- [ ] Traceability matrix maintained
- [ ] Impact analysis possible
- [ ] Coverage gaps identifiable

**Traceability Gaps:** {{TRACEABILITY_GAPS}}

---

## 8. Legal & Compliance

### 8.1 Regulatory Compliance
- [ ] GDPR requirements addressed (if applicable)
- [ ] HIPAA requirements addressed (if applicable)
- [ ] SOC 2 requirements addressed (if applicable)
- [ ] Industry-specific regulations considered
- [ ] Data retention policies defined
- [ ] Privacy requirements specified
- [ ] Audit trail requirements included

**Compliance Gaps:** {{COMPLIANCE_GAPS}}

### 8.2 Intellectual Property
- [ ] No IP conflicts identified
- [ ] Third-party license requirements noted
- [ ] Open-source usage compliant
- [ ] Patent considerations addressed

**IP Issues:** {{IP_ISSUES}}

---

## 9. Security Requirements

### 9.1 Security Coverage
- [ ] Authentication requirements defined
- [ ] Authorization/access control specified
- [ ] Data encryption requirements stated
- [ ] Security audit requirements included
- [ ] Vulnerability management addressed
- [ ] Incident response requirements defined
- [ ] Security testing requirements specified

**Security Gaps:** {{SECURITY_GAPS}}

### 9.2 Threat Modeling
- [ ] Threat scenarios identified
- [ ] Attack surface analyzed
- [ ] Mitigation strategies defined
- [ ] Security risk assessment completed

**Threat Analysis Status:** {{THREAT_STATUS}}

---

## 10. Stakeholder Review

### 10.1 Stakeholder Sign-off

| Stakeholder | Role | Review Date | Status | Comments |
|-------------|------|-------------|--------|----------|
| {{STAKEHOLDER_1}} | {{ROLE_1}} | {{DATE_1}} | {{STATUS_1}} | {{COMMENTS_1}} |
| {{STAKEHOLDER_2}} | {{ROLE_2}} | {{DATE_2}} | {{STATUS_2}} | {{COMMENTS_2}} |
| {{STAKEHOLDER_3}} | {{ROLE_3}} | {{DATE_3}} | {{STATUS_3}} | {{COMMENTS_3}} |

### 10.2 Stakeholder Feedback
- [ ] All stakeholder comments addressed
- [ ] Conflicting feedback resolved
- [ ] Change requests processed
- [ ] Approval obtained from key stakeholders

**Outstanding Feedback:** {{OUTSTANDING_FEEDBACK}}

---

## 11. Quality Gates

### Gate 1: Initial Review (Before Detailed Design)
- [ ] All completeness criteria met
- [ ] All consistency criteria met
- [ ] All clarity criteria met
- [ ] Stakeholder approval obtained

**Gate 1 Status:** {{GATE1_STATUS}} ✅/❌

### Gate 2: Design Review (After Design)
- [ ] All testability criteria met
- [ ] Design-requirement traceability established
- [ ] Feasibility confirmed

**Gate 2 Status:** {{GATE2_STATUS}} ✅/❌

### Gate 3: Implementation Review (Before Coding)
- [ ] All requirements prioritized
- [ ] Sprint planning completed
- [ ] Test cases defined

**Gate 3 Status:** {{GATE3_STATUS}} ✅/❌

---
